intro: Oenothera minima, commonly known as the dwarf evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow or orange flowers that open in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It has a compact growth habit with hairy stems and linear leaves. Oenothera minima is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
